2.2 Getting started

2.2.1 Installing and loading the required libraries


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork,
               ggthemes, hrbrthemes,
               tidyverse)
```
:::


2.2.2 Importing data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_data <- read_csv("~/Documents/VAA/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::


Beyond ggplot2 Annotation: ggrepel


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS,
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, size=0.5) +
  geom_label(aes(label=ID),
             hjust = .5,
             vjust= -.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.3.1 Working with ggrepel


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS,
           y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, size=0.5) +
  geom_label_repel(aes(label=ID),
                   frontface = "bold") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100),
                  ylim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.4 Beyond ggplot2 Themes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25",
                 fill="grey90") + 
                   theme_gray() +
                   ggtitle("Distribution of Maths Scores")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.4.1 Working with ggtheme package


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data, 
             aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20, 
                 boundary = 100,
                 color="grey25", 
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores") +
  theme_economist()
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.4.2 Working with hrbthems package


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
              aes(x= MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,
                 boundary=100,
                 color="grey25",
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Math Scores")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=672}
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
  theme_ipsum()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}



:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data=exam_data,
       aes(x=MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,
                 boundary=100,
                 color="grey25",
                 fill="grey90") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths Scores") +
  theme_ipsum(axis_text_size = 18, base_size = 15, grid="Y")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.5 Beyond Single Graph


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p1 <- ggplot(data=exam_data,
             aes(x=MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins=20,
                 boundary=100,
                 color="grey25",
                 fill ="grey90") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim=c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths Scores")
print(p1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p2 <- ggplot(data=exam_data,
             aes(x=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary=100, color="grey25", fill="grey90") +
  coord_cartesian(xlim =c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("Distribution of English Scores")
print(p2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-10-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p3 <- ggplot(data=exam_data,
             aes(x=MATHS, y=ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method=lm, size=0.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100), ylim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English vs Maths Scores for Primary 3") +
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size=10))
print(p3)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.5.1 Creating Composite Graphics: Pathwork methods

2.5.2 Combining two ggplot2 graphs


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p1 + p2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.5.3 Combining three ggplot2 graphs


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
(p1/p2) | p3
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.5.4 Creating a composite figure with tag


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
((p1/p2) | p3) +
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = "I")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.5.5 Creating figure with insert


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p3 + inset_element(p2,
                   left = 0.02,
                   bottom = 0.7,
                   right = 0.5,
                   top = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


2.5.6 Creating a composite figure by using patchwork and ggtheme


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
patchwork <- (p1/p2) | p3
patchwork & 
  theme_economist() &
  theme(plot.title = element_text(size=10))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](HandsOnEx2_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::
